channel.title: CVE Feed for Dell -- Secure Connect Gateway (SCG) Policy Manager
channel.description: The latest CVEs for Dell -- Secure Connect Gateway (SCG) Policy Manager

item.title: CVE-2023-39252|2024-08-02T18:02:06.888Z -- dell -- secure%20connect%20gateway%20%28scg%29%20policy%20manager
item.description: Dell SCG Policy Manager 5.16.00.14 contains a broken cryptographic algorithm vulnerability. A remote unauthenticated attacker may potentially exploit this vulnerability by performing MitM attacks and let attackers obtain sensitive information.

item.title: CVE-2024-37131|2024-06-20T15:18:01.330Z -- dell -- secure%20connect%20gateway%20%28scg%29%20policy%20manager
item.description: SCG Policy Manager, all versions, contains an overly permissive Cross-Origin Resource Policy (CORP) vulnerability. A remote unauthenticated attacker could potentially exploit this vulnerability, leading to the execution of malicious actions on the application in the context of the authenticated user.

item.title: CVE-2024-24904|2024-06-04T17:43:36.608Z -- dell -- secure%20connect%20gateway%20%28scg%29%20policy%20manager
item.description: Dell Secure Connect Gateway (SCG) Policy Manager, all versions, contain(s) a Stored Cross-Site Scripting Vulnerability. An adjacent network high privileged attacker could potentially exploit this vulnerability, leading to the storage of malicious HTML or JavaScript codes in a trusted application data store. When a victim user accesses the data store through their browsers, the malicious code gets executed by the web browser in the context of the vulnerable web application. Exploitation may lead to information disclosure, session theft, or client-side request forgery.

item.title: CVE-2024-24905|2024-06-04T17:43:33.107Z -- dell -- secure%20connect%20gateway%20%28scg%29%20policy%20manager
item.description: Dell Secure Connect Gateway (SCG) Policy Manager, all versions, contain(s) a Stored Cross-Site Scripting Vulnerability. An adjacent network high privileged attacker could potentially exploit this vulnerability, leading to the storage of malicious HTML or JavaScript codes in a trusted application data store. When a victim user accesses the data store through their browsers, the malicious code gets executed by the web browser in the context of the vulnerable web application. Exploitation may lead to information disclosure, session theft, or client-side request forgery.

item.title: CVE-2024-24903|2024-03-01T13:30:30.579Z -- dell -- secure%20connect%20gateway%20%28scg%29%20policy%20manager
item.description: Dell Secure Connect Gateway (SCG) Policy Manager, version 5.10+, contain a weak password recovery mechanism for forgotten passwords. An adjacent network low privileged attacker could potentially exploit this vulnerability, leading to unauthorized access to the application with privileges of the compromised account. The attacker could retrieve the reset password token without authorization and then perform the password change.

item.title: CVE-2024-24900|2024-03-01T13:00:00.943Z -- dell -- secure%20connect%20gateway%20%28scg%29%20policy%20manager
item.description: Dell Secure Connect Gateway (SCG) Policy Manager, all versions, contain an improper authorization vulnerability. An adjacent network low privileged attacker could potentially exploit this vulnerability, leading to unauthorized devices added to policies. Exploitation may lead to information disclosure and unauthorized access to the system.

item.title: CVE-2024-24906|2024-06-04T17:43:00.601Z -- dell -- secure%20connect%20gateway%20%28scg%29%20policy%20manager
item.description: Dell Secure Connect Gateway (SCG) Policy Manager, all versions, contain(s) a Stored Cross-Site Scripting Vulnerability in Policy page. An adjacent network high privileged attacker could potentially exploit this vulnerability, leading to the storage of malicious HTML or JavaScript codes in a trusted application data store. When a victim user accesses the data store through their browsers, the malicious code gets executed by the web browser in the context of the vulnerable web application. Exploitation may lead to information disclosure, session theft, or client-side request forgery.

item.title: CVE-2024-24907|2024-03-01T13:14:30.093Z -- dell -- secure%20connect%20gateway%20%28scg%29%20policy%20manager
item.description: Dell Secure Connect Gateway (SCG) Policy Manager, all versions, contain(s) a Stored Cross-Site Scripting Vulnerability in the Filters page. An adjacent network high privileged attacker could potentially exploit this vulnerability, leading to the storage of malicious HTML or JavaScript codes in a trusted application data store. When a victim user accesses the data store through their browsers, the malicious code gets executed by the web browser in the context of the vulnerable web application. Exploitation may lead to information disclosure, session theft, or client-side request forgery.
